Software Craftsmanship North America 2011

  • Archived source: https://web.archive.org/web/20111229061750/http://scna.softwarecraftsmanship.org/
  • Original URL: http://scna.softwarecraftsmanship.org/
  • Snapshot timestamp: 2011-12-29 12:17:50 UTC

Archive Snapshot

home venue schedule speakers sponsors Registration Early Bird Pricing: $415 Extended to July 31st!
Regular Pricing: $495 Register Now! Organized By Presenting Sponsor Sponsored By Media Sponsors
Explore the Art of Software Craftsmanship The complete conference schedule is now available. Check
it out! The last day to get a room at the conference rate of $199/night at the Swissotel is
Thursday, October 27th. Click here to reserve a room.  Come learn, pair, and connect with leading
thinkers and developers from around the world. Celebrate software development and be a part of the
craftsmanship movement. Join us for the most influential event of the year for the software
craftsmanship movement. More than 250 craftsmen from around the world will come together for the 3rd
Annual Software Craftsmanship North America conference. The SCNA Welcome Reception is Thursday,
November 17th from 5pm-7pm at Elephant & Castle, 185 N. Wabash. Tickets are $40 and include happy
hour cocktails and snacks. You can purchase your tickets at the registration link, or at the door. 
Corey Haines will be hosting another Code Retreat on Sunday, November 20th, at the 8th Light Chicago
office. RSVP now! What's New in 2011? SCNA offers a wide variety of opportunities for veteran
craftsmen and journeymen alike. Opportunities To Connect Whether celebrating at our opening night
reception or sharing an impromptu breakfast with colleagues before the keynote presentation, there
will be lots of opportunities for you to meet new people, share ideas, and network with like-minded
professionals from all over the world. Part of the reason you attend is to share experiences with
peers and colleagues, and we’re excited about offering ways for you to do that. Defining An Industry
SCNA features industry-leading speakers presenting relevant, applicable topics that impact not only
the way you work, but also but the way you think about your work. Check back here for opportunities
for you to participate in the selection of speakers and topics for sessions at the conference.
Celebrating Community Having a great keynote speaker and solid group sessions is imperative, but we
know the value in setting aside time for you pair with colleagues. SCNA provides time and space for
smaller, tactile sessions to share best practices and information on your own. In software
craftsmanship, everyone has something vital to share. Events In addition to the conference itself,
SCNA is hosting a 5K run on the morning of Saturday, the 19th, at 6:30AM. 8th Light will be hosting
a Code Retreat at their offices on Sunday, the 20th, facilitated by Corey Haines. RSVP here!
Sponsorship If you’re interested in becoming a sponsor, please contact us for the 2011 Prospectus. ©
2011 Software Craftsmanship North America
